channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Morning news brief
item.description: Trump says the U.S. military conducted a strike on a Venezuelan dock he claims was used by drug smugglers, protests over economy flood Iran, flu cases...

item.title: A little boy gave her hope for her foster daughter's future
item.description: At a neighborhood park, a young boy noticed Natalie's young foster daughter using a walker. His reaction left Natalie with an unexpected feeling of ho...

item.title: Why do we make New Year's resolutions? A brief history of a long tradition
item.description: One of the earliest mentions of New Year's resolutions appeared in a Boston newspaper in 1813. But the practice itself can be traced back to the Babyl...

item.title: In one year, Trump pivots fentanyl response from public health to drug war

item.title: National Guard arrives in New Orleans for 1st New Year's since Bourbon Street attack
item.description: Nearly a year after a New Year's Day truck attack on Bourbon Street left 14 dead, New Orleans officials are still seeking permanent security solutions...

item.title: Huge crowds mourn Bangladesh's first female PM at state funeral
item.description: A sea of mourners have gathered in Dhaka to pay final respects to Khaleda Zia, who died on Tuesday aged 80.

item.title: HHS freezes all child care payments to Minnesota after viral fraud allegations

item.title: Democratic win in Iowa special election denies GOP a Legislature supermajority
item.description: Democrat Renee Hardman was elected to the Iowa state Senate in a year-end special election, keeping Republicans from reclaiming two-thirds control of ...

item.title: Heated Rivalry author says TV success led to help with her Parkinson's
item.description: Rachel Reid says the publicity from the hit TV adaptation led a Parkinson's specialist to get in touch.

item.title: Guinea junta chief wins presidential election by landslide
item.description: The victory, which gives the junta leader a seven-year mandate, was widely expected.

item.title: 12/30: CBS Evening News
item.description: Dangerous cold and snow slam large swaths of U.S.; We asked people to reflect on 2025 and share their hopes for 2026

item.title: Eurostar services return to normal after major Channel Tunnel disruption
item.description: The high-speed rail firm urged passengers to check before they travel as last-minute delays and cancellations are still possible.

item.title: Mali and Burkina Faso impose travel ban on US citizens in tit-for-tat move
item.description: The two states say they are taking reciprocal measures after the US announced full-entry restrictions on their citizens.

item.title: Is anything open on New Year's Eve 2025? See which stores are operating.
item.description: Most major retailers and grocery stores will be open on New Year's Eve, although some will have reduced hours.

item.title: Former Republican Sen. Jon Kyl of Arizona says he has dementia
item.description: Former Republican U.S. Sen. Jon Kyl of Arizona announced his withdrawal from public life following a dementia diagnosis.
